Description: A man's large coat, an 'abaya'. Nearly square in shape and made from two equal sized pieces of natural light brown tabby woven wool (?) cloth, the selvedges machine stitched together around the waistline. Armhole is a small slit. Mid-blue (indigo dyed?) tabby woven cotton cloth facing around the neckline. All edges (save the hem) trimmed with plaited gold-coloured metal-wrapped thread. More elaborate couched braidwork using the same material at the neck. Two identical pieces of composite passementerie at chest level: three baubles with three smaller baubles on lengths of braid, worked in gold-coloured metal-wrapped thread. A little staining and a small hole on back.
Production place: Made in: Libya (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Tunisia (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Jordan (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Curator's comments: Donations and Purchases Book Volume 9: 'Arab' and 'Five pieces comprising an Arab costume'; Asia Collections storage intake book: 'Middle East'. In the opinion of Sahar el-Sayed (textile curator, Cairo Textile Museum) these clothes are festive dress, worn by a man living in a rural environment. Garment worn with As1979,14 .1 jacket .2 waistcoat .3 coat .4 shawl, scarf
